label: AB_hP16_186_ac_bc-002
title: Low Temperature Nb$_{1-x}$S Structure
comments:
This is the low-temperature structure of sulfur-rich NbS, tempered at $\approx 650^\circ$C from the high-temperature phase, which takes on the \href{http://www.aflow.org/AB_oP8_62_c_c-002.html}{orthorhombic MnP ($B31$) structure}. The metal-rich form, Nb$_{1+x}$S, is in the \href{http://www.aflow.org/AB_hP4_194_c_a.html}{NiAs ($B8_{1}$) structure}. 
 (Kadijk, 1969) give the occupancy of the Nb (2a) site as 68\%, making the stoichiometry of this sample Nb$_{0.92}$S. 
 Space group $P6_{3}mc \#186$ does not define the origin of the $z$-axis.  Here we follow (Kadijk, 1969) and set $z_{1} = 0$ for the Nb-I site. 
 While (Kadijk, 1969) set x$_{4}$=0.1634 for the S II site, the ICSD entry uses x$_{4}$=-0.1634.  Using the former value gives unusual voids in the crystal structure which are not found with the later value.  Accordingly we use the ICSD value -0.1634.
